translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Our angels came to Abraham with good news, and said: "Peace on you. "Peace on you too," said Abraham, and hastened to bring a roasted calf.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed Our angels came to Ibrahim with glad tidings – they said, “Peace”; he answered, “Peace” and without delay brought a roasted calf.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings; they said, 'Peace!' 'Peace,' he said; and presently he brought a roasted calf.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly Our messengers came unto Ibrahim with the glad tidings. The said: peace! He said: peace! And he tarried not till he brougt a calf roasted.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And verily, there came Our Messengers to Ibrahim (Abraham) with glad tidings. They said: Salam (greetings or peace!) He answered, Salam (greetings or peace!) and he hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with good news. They said, “Peace.” He said, “Peace.” Soon after, he came with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed Our messengers came to Abraham, bearing glad tidings. They greeted him with 'peace', and Abraham answered back to them 'peace', and hurriedly brought to them a roasted calf.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And verily, there came Our messengers to Ibrahim with the glad tidings. They said: "Salaman (greetings or peace!)" He answered, "Salamun (greetings or peace!)," and he hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Our messengers cam unto Abraham with good news. They said: Peace! He answered: Peace! and delayed not to bring a roasted calf.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly Our messengers came to Abraham with the good news, and said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He replied. Presently he brought [for them] a roasted calf.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Our Messengers came to Abraham with glad tidings. They said: 'Peace' He replied 'Peace' and in a while brought them a roasted calf.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And certainly did Our messengers come to Abraham with good tidings; they said, "Peace." He said, "Peace," and did not delay in bringing [them] a roasted calf.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Our Messengers came to Abraham with glad news. They said, "Peace be with you." He replied similarly. After a short time he presented them with a roasted calf

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly Our apostles came to Ibrahim with good news. They said: Peace. Peace, said he, and he made no delay in bringing a roasted calf.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with good news and greeted him with, "Peace." He too said, "Peace be on you," and hastened to bring a roasted calf.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: There came Our messengers to Abraham with glad tidings. They said, "Peace!" He answered, "Peace!" and hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Abraham was kind, compassionate, and penitent.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed Ibrahim is most forbearing, very soft hearted, penitent.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Abraham was clement, compassionate, penitent.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily Ibrahim was forbearing, long-suffering, penitent.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, Ibrahim (Abraham) was, without doubt, forbearing, used to invoke Allah with humility, and was repentant (to Allah all the time, again and again).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Abraham was gentle, kind, penitent.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and oft-turning to Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, Ibrahim was, without doubt, forbearing, used to invoke Allah with humility, and was repentant.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! Abraham was mild, imploring, penitent.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Abraham was indeed most forbearing, plaintive, [and] penitent.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: indeed, Abraham was forbearing, tenderhearted and penitent.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to Allah].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham was certainly a forbearing, compassionate, and tender-hearted person.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Most surely Ibrahim was forbearing, tender-hearted, oft-returning (to Allah):

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: for Abraham was forbearing, tender-hearted and oft-returning to God.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: For Abraham was, without doubt, forbearing (of faults), compassionate, and given to look to Allah.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Desist from pleading, O Abraham," (they said). "Your Lord's command has verily been issued, and a punishment that cannot be averted is bound to fall on them."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O Ibrahim, turn away from this; indeed your Lord’s command has come; and indeed a punishment will come upon them, which will not be averted.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'O Abraham, turn away from this; thy Lord's command has surely come, and there is coming upon them a chastisement not to be turned back.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: O Ibrahim! leave off this; verily the decree from thy Lord hath already come, and verily they! upon them is coming a torment unavoidable.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "O Ibrahim (Abraham)! Forsake this. Indeed, the Commandment of your Lord has gone forth. Verily, there will come a torment for them which cannot be turned back."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “O Abraham, refrain from this. The command of your Lord has come; they have incurred an irreversible punishment.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thereupon (Our angels) said to him: 'O Abraham! Desist from this, for indeed your Lord's command has come; and a chastisement which cannot be averted is about to befall them.' words literally suggest; the purpose is merely to express a sense of wonder.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "O Ibrahim! Forsake this. Indeed, the commandment of your Lord has gone forth. Verily, there will come a torment for them which cannot be turned back."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (It was said) O Abraham! Forsake this! Lo! thy Lord's commandment hath gone forth, and lo! there cometh unto them a doom which cannot be repelled.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: ‘O Abraham, let this matter alone! Your Lord’s edict has certainly come, and an irrevocable punishment shall overtake them.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (It was said:) 'Abraham, turn away from this; your Lord's command has indeed come, and there is coming upon them a punishment that will not be turned back'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [The angels said], "O Abraham, give up this [plea]. Indeed, the command of your Lord has come, and indeed, there will reach them a punishment that cannot be repelled."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We said, "Abraham, avoid asking Us such questions. Your Lord's decree has already been issued and an inevitable torment will strike these people."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: O Ibrahim! leave off this, surely the decree of your Lord has come to pass, and surely there must come to them a chastisement that cannot be averted.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We said, "Abraham, cease your pleading: the command of your Lord has gone forth. There shall fall upon them a punishment which none can avert!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O Abraham! Seek not this. The decree of thy Lord hath gone forth: for them there cometh a penalty that cannot be turned back!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: I follow the faith of my fathers, of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. We cannot associate anyone with God. This is among God's favours to us and to all mankind; but most men are not grateful.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “And I have chosen the religion of my forefathers, Ibrahim and Ishaq and Yaqub; it is not rightful for us to ascribe anything as a partner to Allah; this is a grace of Allah upon us and upon mankind, but most men are not thankful.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And I have followed the creed of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. Not ours is it to associate aught with God. That is of God's bounty to us, and to men; but most men are not thankful.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And I have followed the creed of my fathers, Ibrahim and Is'haq and ya'qub: it is not for us to associate aught with Allah. That is of Allah's and upon mankind; but grace upon us most of mankind thank not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And I have followed the religion of my fathers, - Ibrahim (Abraham), Ishaque (Isaac) and Ya'qub (Jacob)], and never could we attribute any partners whatsoever to Allah. This is from the Grace of Allah to us and to mankind, but most men thank not (i.e. they neither believe in Allah, nor worship Him).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: “And I have followed the faith of my forefathers, Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob. It is not for us to associate anything with God. This is by virtue of God’s grace upon us and upon the people, but most people do not give thanks.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and I have adopted the way of my forefathers - Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. It is not for us to associate any with Allah in His Divinity. It is out of Allah's grace upon us and upon mankind (that He did not require of us to serve any other than Allah), and yet most people do not give thanks.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And I have followed the religion of my fathers, - Ibrahim, Ishaq and Ya'qub and never could we attribute any partners whatsoever to Allah. This is from the grace of Allah to us and to mankind, but most men thank not.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. It never was for us to attribute aught as partner to Allah. This is of the bounty of Allah unto us (the seed of Abraham) and unto mankind; but most men give not thanks.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: I follow the creed of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. It is not for us to ascribe any partner to Allah. That is by virtue of Allah’s grace upon us and upon all mankind, but most people do not give thanks.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: I follow the creed of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. It is not for us to associate anything with Allah. Such is the favor of Allah to us, and to mankind. Yet most people do not give thanks.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. And it was not for us to associate anything with Allah. That is from the favor of Allah upon us and upon the people, but most of the people are not grateful.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and I have embraced the religion of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. We are not supposed to consider anything equal to God. This is part of God's blessing to us and the people, but most people do not give thanks.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And I follow the religion of my fathers, Ibrahim and Ishaq and Yaqoub; it beseems us not that we should associate aught with Allah; this is by Allah's grace upon us and on mankind, but most people do not give thanks:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: I follow the religion of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob; and it is not for us to associate anyone with God as a partner. This is of God's grace upon us and upon mankind; even though most men are not grateful.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "And I follow the ways of my fathers,- Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and never could we attribute any partners whatever to Allah: that (comes) of the grace of Allah to us and to mankind: yet most men are not grateful.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Your Lord will choose you and teach you to interpret events, and confer His favours on you and the house of Jacob, as He had done in the case of two ancestors of yours, Abraham and Isaac, before you. Indeed your Lord is all-knowing and all-wise."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “And this is how your Lord will choose you and teach you how to interpret events, and will perfect His favours upon you and upon the family of Yaqub, the way He perfected it upon both your forefathers, Ibrahim and Ishaq; indeed your Lord is All Knowing, Wise.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So will thy Lord choose thee, and teach thee the interpretation of tales, and perfect His blessing upon thee and upon the House of Jacob, as He perfected it formerly on thy fathers Abraham and Isaac; surely thy Lord is All-knowing, All-wise.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Thus will thy Lord choose thee and teach thee of the interpretation of discourses, and will fulfil His favour upon thee and upon the house of Y'aqub even as He fulfilled it upon thy fathers, Ibrahim and Is-haq aforetime; verily thy Lord is Knowing, Wise.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of dreams (and other things) and perfect His Favour on you and on the offspring of Ya'qub (Jacob), as He perfected it on your fathers, Ibrahim (Abraham) and Ishaque (Isaac) aforetime! Verily, your Lord is All-Knowing, All-Wise."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And thus your Lord will choose you, and will teach you the interpretation of events, and will complete His blessing upon you and upon the family of Jacob, as He has completed it before upon your forefathers Abraham and Isaac. Your Lord is Knowing and Wise.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (As you have seen in the dream), so will your Lord choose you (for His task) and will impart to you the comprehension of the deeper meaning of things and will bestow the full measure of His favour upon you and upon the house of Jacob even as He earlier bestowed it in full measure upon your forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Surely your Lord is All- Knowing, All-Wise."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of dreams (and other things) and perfect His favor on you and on the offspring of Ya`qub, as He perfected it on your fathers, Ibrahim and Ishaq aforetime! Verily, your Lord is All-Knowing, All-Wise."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Thus thy Lord will prefer thee and will teach thee the interpretation of events, and will perfect His grace upon thee and upon the family of Jacob as He perfected it upon thy forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Lo! thy Lord is Knower, Wise.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: That is how your Lord will choose you, and teach you the interpretation of dreams, and complete His blessing upon you and upon the house of Jacob, just as He completed it earlier for your fathers, Abraham and Isaac. Your Lord is indeed all-knowing and all-wise.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: so your Lord will choose you and teach you the interpretation of visions, and perfect His Favor upon you and upon the House of Jacob, as He perfected it on your fathers Abraham and Isaac before you. Your Lord is Knowing, Wise.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of narratives and complete His favor upon you and upon the family of Jacob, as He completed it upon your fathers before, Abraham and Isaac. Indeed, your Lord is Knowing and Wise."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Thus, your Lord will select you, teach you the interpretation of dreams, and grant His favors to you and the family of Jacob, just as He granted His favors to your fathers, Abraham and Isaac. Your Lord is certainly All-knowing and All-wise."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of sayings and make His favor complete to you and to the children of Yaqoub, as He made it complete before to your fathers, Ibrahim and Ishaq; surely your Lord is Knowing, Wise.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: You shall be chosen by your Lord and He will impart to you some understanding of the inner meaning of events. He will bestow the full measure of His blessings upon you and upon the House of Jacob -- even as He formerly bestowed it in full measure upon your forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Truly, your Sustainer is all-knowing and wise!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Thus will thy Lord choose thee and teach thee the interpretation of stories (and events) and perfect His favour to thee and to the posterity of Jacob - even as He perfected it to thy fathers Abraham and Isaac aforetime! for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember when Abraham prayed: "O Lord, make this a city of peace, and preserve me and my progeny from worshipping idols:

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember when Ibrahim prayed, “O my Lord! Make this town (Mecca) a safe one, and safeguard me and my sons from worshipping idols.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Abraham said, 'My Lord, make this land secure, and turn me and my sons away from serving idols;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Ibrahim said: my Lord! make this City secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping the idols.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "O my Lord! Make this city (Makkah) one of peace and security, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Recall that Abraham said, “O my Lord, make this land peaceful, and keep me and my sons from worshiping idols.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And call to mind when Abraham prayed: "My Lord! Make this city secure, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping the idols.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim said: "O my Lord! Make this city (Makkah) one of peace and security, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Abraham said: My Lord! Make safe this territory, and preserve me and my sons from serving idols.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Abraham said, ‘My Lord! Make this city a sanctuary, and save me and my children from worshiping idols.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Abraham said: 'My Lord, make this a land secure. Turn me and my children away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city [Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), consider when Abraham prayed, "Lord, make this (Mecca) a peaceful territory and save me and my offspring from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim said: My Lord! make this city secure, and save me and my sons from worshipping idols:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [Remember] when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a city of peace and help me and my children to keep away from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Remember Abraham said: "O my Lord! make this city one of peace and security: and preserve me and my sons from worshipping idols.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Abraham was certainly a model of faith, obedient to God and upright, and not one of idolaters,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed Ibrahim was a leader, obedient to Allah, and detached from all; and he was not a polytheist.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Surely, Abraham was a nation obedient unto God, a man of pure faith and no idolater,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily Ibrahim was a pattern, devout unto Allah, upright, and, not of the associaters.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, Ibrahim (Abraham) was an Ummah (a leader having all the good righteous qualities), or a nation, obedient to Allah, Hanifa (i.e. to worship none but Allah), and he was not one of those who were Al-Mushrikun (polytheists, idolaters, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, and those who joined partners with Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Abraham was an exemplary leader, devoted to God, a monotheist, and was not of the polytheists.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed Abraham was a whole community by himself, obedient to Allah, exclusively devoted to Him. And he was never one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, Ibrahim was (himself) an Ummah, obedient to Allah, a Hanif (monotheist), and he was not one of the idolators.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! Abraham was a nation obedient to Allah, by nature upright, and he was not of the idolaters;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed Abraham was a nation [all by himself], obedient to Allah, a Hanif, and he was not a polytheist.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Abraham was (equal to) a nation, obedient to Allah, of pure faith and was not among the idolaters,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham was, certainly, an obedient and upright person. He was not a pagan.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely Ibrahim was an exemplar, obedient to Allah, upright, and he was not of the polytheists.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham was a community in himself devoted to God and true in faith, He was not one of the polytheists;

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Abraham was indeed a model, devoutly obedient to Allah, (and) true in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: So We commanded you to follow the way of Abraham the upright who was not of idolaters.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And then We sent you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) the divine revelation that, “Follow the religion of Ibrahim, who was free from all falsehood; and was not a polytheist.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then We revealed to thee: 'Follow thou the creed of Abraham, a man of pure faith and no idolater.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Afterwards We revealed unto thee: follow thou the faith of Ibrahim the upright; and he was not of the associaters.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then, We have inspired you (O Muhammad SAW saying): "Follow the religion of Ibrahim (Abraham) Hanifa (Islamic Monotheism - to worship none but Allah) and he was not of the Mushrikun (polytheists, idolaters, disbelievers, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then We inspired you: “Follow the religion of Abraham, the Monotheist. He was not an idol-worshiper.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We revealed to you: "Follow the way of Abraham with exclusive devotion to Allah. He was not one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then, We have sent the revelation to you: "Follow the religion of Ibrahim (he was a) Hanif, and he was not one of the idolators."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And afterward We inspired thee (Muhammad, saying): Follow the religion of Abraham, as one by nature upright. He was not of the idolaters.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thereafter We revealed to you [saying], ‘Follow the creed of Abraham, a Hanif, who was not a polytheist.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then, We revealed to you: 'Follow the Creed of Abraham, he of pure faith, he was not among the idolaters'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allah.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent you, (Muhammad), a revelation that you should follow the tradition of Abraham, the upright one, who was not a pagan.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Then We revealed to you: Follow the faith of Ibrahim, the upright one, and he was not of the polytheists.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then We revealed Our will to you [O Muhammad], saying, "Follow the religion of Abraham, the upright in faith; he was not one of the polytheists."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So We have taught thee the inspired (Message), "Follow the ways of Abraham the True in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Commemorate Abraham in the Book: He was upright, a prophet.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember Ibrahim in the Book; he was very truthful, a Herald of the Hidden (a Prophet).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And mention in the Book Abraham; surely he was a true man, a Prophet.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And mention thou in the Book Ibrahim; verily he was a man of truth, a prophet.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And mention in the Book (the Quran) Ibrahim (Abraham). Verily! He was a man of truth, a Prophet.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And mention in the Scripture Abraham. He was a man of truth, a prophet.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Abraham. Most surely he was a man of truth, a Prophet.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Ibrahim. Verily, he was a man of truth, a Prophet.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And make mention (O Muhammad) in the Scripture of Abraham. Lo! he was a saint, a prophet.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And mention in the Book Abraham. Indeed, he was a truthful man and a prophet.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Mention in the Book Abraham; He was truthful and a Prophet.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Mention the story of Abraham, the truthful Prophet, in the Book (the Quran)

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And mention Ibrahim in the Book; surely he was a truthful man, a prophet.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Also recount the story of Abraham in the Book. He was a man of truth, and a prophet.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: He was a man of Truth, a prophet.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "Are you averse to my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall have you stoned to death. So go away for a while from me."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He said, “What! You turn away from my Gods, O Ibrahim? If you do not desist, I will certainly stone you, and keep no relation with me for a long while.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'What, art thou shrinking from my gods, Abraham? Surely, if thou givest not over, I shall stone thee; so forsake me now for some while.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: He said: art thou averse to my gods, O Ibrahim? If thou desistest not, surely I shall stone thee; and depart from me for ever so long.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He (the father) said: "Do you reject my gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)? If you stop not (this), I will indeed stone you. So get away from me safely before I punish you."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “Are you renouncing my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will stone you. So leave me alone for a while.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The father said: "Abraham, have you turned away from my gods? If you do not give this up, I shall stone you to death. Now begone from me forever."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He (the father) said: "Do you revile my gods, O Ibrahim If you stop not (this), I will La'arjumannak. So get away from me Maliyan."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: Rejectest thou my gods, O Abraham? If thou cease not, I shall surely stone thee. Depart from me a long while!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Abraham! Are you renouncing my gods? If you do not desist, I will stone you. Get away from me for a long while.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But he replied: 'Do you shrink away from my gods, Abraham? Surely, if you do not cease I will stone you, so leave me for awhile'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: His father replied, "Abraham, are you telling me to give-up my gods? If you will not stop this, I shall stone you to death. Leave my house and do not come back again".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: Do you dislike my gods, O Ibrahim? If you do not desist I will certainly revile you, and leave me for a time.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: [His father] said, "Do you reject my deities, Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall surely stone you to death. Keep out of my way!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: They said: "We heard a youth talk about them. He is called Abraham."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Some among them said, “We heard a youth speak ill of them – the one called Ibrahim.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'We heard a young man making mention of them, and he was called Abraham.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth speak of them, who is called Ibrahim.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "We heard a young man talking (against) them who is called Ibrahim (Abraham)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “We heard a youth mentioning them. He is called Abraham.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Some of them said: "We heard a youth called Abraham speak (ill) of them."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "We heard a young man talking against them, who is called Ibrahim."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth make mention of them, who is called Abraham.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘We heard a young man mentioning them. He is called ‘‘Abraham.’’ ’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'We have heard a young man called Abraham mention them' they replied.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Some of them said, "We heard a youth called Abraham speaking against the idols".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: We heard a youth called Ibrahim speak of them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Some said, "We heard a young man, called Abraham, talking about them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Did you do this to our gods, O Abraham?" they enquired.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: They said, “Did you do this to our Gods, O Ibrahim?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They said, 'So, art thou the man who did this unto our gods, Abraham?'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: They said: art thou the one who hath wrought this unto our gods, O Ibrahim?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrahim (Abraham)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Are you the one who did this to our gods, O Abraham?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (On Abraham's arrival) they said: "Abraham, are you he who has done this to our gods?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They said: "Are you the one who has done this to our gods, O Ibrahim"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: They said: Is it thou who hast done this to our gods, O Abraham?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They said, ‘Was it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Abraham' they said, 'was it you who did this to our gods'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They asked, "Abraham, did you do this to our idols?"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: They said: Have you done this to our gods, O Ibrahim?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They said, "Abraham, was it you who did this to our deities?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Turn cold, O fire," We said, "and give safety to Abraham."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: We said, “O fire, become cool and peaceful upon Ibrahim.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We said, 'O fire, be coolness and safety for Abraham!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: We said: O fire! be thou cool and peace unto Ibrahim

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: We (Allah) said: "O fire! Be you coolness and safety for Ibrahim (Abraham)!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We said, “O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We said: "O fire, become coolness and safety for Abraham."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: We said: "O fire! Be you cool and safety for Ibrahim!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We said: O fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We said, ‘O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'O Fire' We said, 'be coolness and safety for Abraham'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Allah said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We said to the fire, "Be cool and peaceful (with Abraham)".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: We said: O fire! be a comfort and peace to Ibrahim;

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: But We said, "Fire! Be cool and a means of safety for Abraham."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We said, "O Fire! be thou cool, and (a means of) safety for Abraham!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When We chose the site of the House for Abraham (We said:) "Associate no one with Me, and clean My House for those who will circumambulate it, stand (in reverence), and bow in homage.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember when We showed Ibrahim the right place of the Sacred House (mosque) and commanded that, “Do not ascribe anything as a partner to Me, and keep My House clean for those who encircle it and those who stay in it (for worship) and those who bow and prostrate.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We settled for Abraham the place of the House: 'Thou shall not associate with Me anything. And do thou purify My House for those that shall go about it and those that stand, for those that bow and prostrate themselves;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We settled Ibrahim in the place of the House, Saying: associate not thou with Me aught, and purify My House for these who circumambulate and those who stand up and those who bow and make prostration.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We showed Ibrahim (Abraham) the site of the (Sacred) House (the Ka'bah at Makkah) (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me, [La ilaha ill-Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah Islamic Monotheism], and sanctify My House for those who circumambulate it, and those who stand up for prayer, and those who bow (submit themselves with humility and obedience to Allah), and make prostration (in prayer, etc.);"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We showed Abraham the location of the House: “Do not associate anything with Me; and purify My House for those who circle around, and those who stand to pray, and those who kneel and prostrate.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Call to mind when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House (Kabah), directing him: "Do not associate aught with Me" and "Keep My House pure for those who walk around it, and for those who stand and who bow down and who prostrate themselves (in worship),

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We showed Ibrahim the site of the House (saying): "Associate not anything with Me, and sanctify My House for those who circumambulate it, and those who stand up (for prayer), and those who bow and make prostration (in prayer);"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (remember) when We prepared for Abraham the place of the (holy) House, saying: Ascribe thou no thing as partner unto Me, and purify My House for those who make the round (thereof) and those who stand and those who bow and make prostration.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When We settled for Abraham the site of the House [saying], Do not ascribe any partners to Me, and purify My House for those who circle around it, and those who stand [in it for prayer], and those who bow and prostrate themselves.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when We settled for Abraham (and Ishmael) the place of the Holy Mosque, (We said): 'You shall not associate with Me anything. Purify My House for those who circumambulate it and those who stand, for those who bow and prostrate.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When We prepared for Abraham the place to build the Sacred House, We told him not to consider anything equal to Me and to keep the House clean for those walking around it, those standing, bowing down, and prostrating in prayer.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We assigned to Ibrahim the place of the House, saying: Do not associate with Me aught, and purify My House for those who make the circuit and stand to pray and bow and prostrate themselves.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We assigned to Abraham the site of the House, saying, "Do not associate with Me anything and purify My House for those who circumambulate [the Kabah] and those who stand upright, and those who bow and prostrate themselves."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And the people of Abraham and Lot,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And (so did) the people of Ibrahim and the people of Lut.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and the people of Abraham, the people of Lot,

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And the people of Ibrahim and the people of Lut.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And the people of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the people of Lout (Lot),

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And the people of Abraham, and the people of Lot.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and so too did the people of Abraham and the people of Lot;

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And the people of Ibrahim and the people of Lut,

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And the folk of Abraham and the folk of Lot;

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: [as well as] the people of Abraham and the people of Lot,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and the nation of Abraham and the nation of Lot;

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and the people of Abraham, Lot,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the people of Ibrahim and the people of Lut,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So did the people of Abraham and the people of Lot,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Those of Abraham and Lut;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Strive in the way of God with a service worthy of Him. He has chosen you and laid no hardship on you in the way of faith, the faith of your forbear Abraham. He named you Muslim earlier, and in this (Qur'an), in order that the Prophet be witness over you, and you be witness over mankind. So be firm in devotion, pay the zakat, and hold on firmly to God. He is your friend: How excellent a friend is He, how excellent a helper!

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And fight in Allah's cause as is the true manner of fighting; He has preferred you and has not kept any hardship upon you in religion; the religion of your father Ibrahim; Allah has named you Muslims – in the previous Books and in this Qur’an, so that the Noble Messenger be your guardian and witness, and you be witness against other people; therefore keep the prayer established and give charity, and hold fast to the rope of Allah; He is your Master; so what an excellent Master and what an excellent Supporter!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and struggle for God as is His due, for He has chosen you, and has laid on you no impediment in your religion, being the creed of your father Abraham; He named you Muslims aforetime and in this, that the Messenger might be a witness against you, and that you might be witnesses against mankind. So perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and hold you fast to God; He is your Protector -- an excellent Protector, an excellent Helper.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And strive hard for Allah as is due unto Him hard striving. He hath distinguished you, and hath not placed upon you any narrowness in the religion the faith of your father, Ibrahim. He hath named you Muslim aforetime and in this, that the apostle may be a witness for you, and that ye may be witnesses against mankind. Wherefore establish the prayer and'give the poor-rate, and hold fast by Allah; He is your Patron: an Excellent Patron and Excellent helper!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And strive hard in Allah's Cause as you ought to strive (with sincerity and with all your efforts that His Name should be superior). He has chosen you (to convey His Message of Islamic Monotheism to mankind by inviting them to His religion, Islam), and has not laid upon you in religion any hardship, it is the religion of your father Ibrahim (Abraham) (Islamic Monotheism). It is He (Allah) Who has named you Muslims both before and in this (the Quran), that the Messenger (Muhammad SAW) may be a witness over you and you be witnesses over mankind! So perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), give Zakat and hold fast to Allah [i.e. have confidence in Allah, and depend upon Him in all your affairs] He is your Maula (Patron, Lord, etc.), what an Excellent Maula (Patron, Lord, etc.) and what an Excellent Helper!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And strive for God, with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you, and has not burdened you in religion—the faith of your father Abraham. It is he who named you Muslims before, and in this. So that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and you may be witnesses over the people. So pray regularly, and give regular charity, and cleave to God. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector, and what an excellent Helper.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Strive in the cause of Allah in a manner worthy of that striving. He has chosen you (for His task), and He has not laid upon you any hardship in religion. Keep to the faith of your father Abraham. Allah named you Muslims earlier and even in this (Book), that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over all mankind. So establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector; what an excellent Helper!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And strive hard in Allah's cause as you ought to strive. He has chosen you, and has not laid upon you in religion any hardship: it is the religion of your father Ibrahim. He has named you Muslims both before and in this (Qur'an), that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you be witnesses over mankind! So, perform the Salah, give the Zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your Mawla, what an Excellent Mawla and what an Excellent Helper!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And strive for Allah with the endeavour which is His right. He hath chosen you and hath not laid upon you in religion any hardship; the faith of your father Abraham (is yours). He hath named you Muslims of old time and in this (Scripture), that the messenger may be a witness against you, and that ye may be witnesses against mankind. So establish worship, pay the poor-due, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protecting friend. A blessed Patron and a blessed Helper!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And wage jihad for the sake of Allah, a jihad which is worthy of Him. He has chosen you and has not placed for you any obstacle in the religion, the faith of your father, Abraham. He named you ‘Muslims’ before, and in this, so that the Apostle may be a witness to you, and that you may be witnesses to mankind. So maintain the prayer, give the zakat, and hold fast to Allah. He is your master—an excellent master and an excellent helper.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Struggle for Allah as is due to Him. He has chosen you and has not laden a burden upon you in your religion, being the Creed of Abraham your father. He has named you Muslims before and in this so that the Messenger (Muhammad) can be a witness for you, and in order that you be witnesses against mankind. Therefore, establish the prayer and pay the obligatory charity and hold fast to Allah. He is your Guardian, the Excellent Guardian, the Excellent Helper!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Strive steadfastly for the Cause of God. He has chosen you but has not imposed on you hardship in your religion, the noble religion of your father, Abraham. God named you Muslims before and in this Book, so that the Messenger will witness (your actions) and will be the witness over mankind. Be steadfast in your prayer, pay the religious tax, and seek protection from God; He is your Guardian, a gracious Guardian and Helper.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And strive hard in (the way of) Allah, (such) a striving as is due to Him; He has chosen you and has not laid upon you an hardship in religion; the faith of your father Ibrahim; He named you Muslims before and in this, that the Apostle may be a bearer of witness to you, and you may be bearers of witness to the people; therefore keep up prayer and pay the poor-rate and hold fast by Allah; He is your Guardian; how excellent the Guardian and how excellent the Helper!

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Strive for the cause of God as it behoves you to strive for it. He has chosen you and laid on you no burden in the matter of your religion, the faith of Abraham your forefather. In this, as in former scriptures He has given you the name of Muslims, so that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and so that you may be witnesses over mankind. Therefore, say your prayers regularly and pay the zakat and hold fast to God. He is your master. An excellent master and an excellent helper!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And strive in His cause as ye ought to strive, (with sincerity and under discipline). He has chosen you, and has imposed no difficulties on you in religion; it is the cult of your father Abraham. It is He Who has named you Muslims, both before and in this (Revelation); that the Messenger may be a witness for you, and ye be witnesses for mankind! So establish regular Prayer, give regular Charity, and hold fast to Allah! He is your Protector - the Best to protect and the Best to help!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And (remember) Abraham who said to his people: "Worship God and be obedient to Him. This is better for you if you understand.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And (remember) Ibrahim – when he said to his people, “Worship Allah and fear Him; that is better for you, if you knew!”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Abraham, when he said to his people, 'Serve God, and fear Him; that is better for you, did you know.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And We sent Ibrahim. Recall what time he said unto his people: worship Allah, and fear Him; that is best for you if ye but knew.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) Ibrahim (Abraham) when he said to his people: "Worship Allah (Alone), and fear Him, that is better for you if you did but know.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Abraham, when he said to his people, “Worship God, and fear Him. That is better for you, if you only knew.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We sent Abraham and he said to his people: “Serve Allah and fear Him. This is better for you if you only knew.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) Ibrahim when he said to his people: "Worship Allah, and have Taqwa of Him, that is better for you if you know."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Abraham! (Remember) when he said unto his folk: Serve Allah, and keep your duty unto Him; that is better for you if ye did but know.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And Abraham, when he said to his people, ‘Worship Allah and be wary of Him. That is better for you, should you know.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And (remember) Abraham. When he said to his people 'Worship Allah and fear Him. That would be best for you, if you but knew.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [We sent] Abraham, when he said to his people, "Worship Allah and fear Him. That is best for you, if you should know.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham told his people, "Worship God and have fear of Him. It is better for you if only you knew it.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And (We sent) Ibrahim, when he said to his people: Serve Allah and be careful of (your duty to) Him; this is best for you, if you did but know:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell of Abraham. He said to his people, "Worship God and fear Him, that would be best for you, if only you knew.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And (We also saved) Abraham: behold, he said to his people, "Serve Allah and fear Him: that will be best for you- If ye understand!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When Our messengers came to Abraham with good news, they said: "We have to destroy this city as its inhabitants have become sinful."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And when Our sent angels came with glad tidings to Ibrahim, they said, “We will surely destroy the people of that town; indeed its inhabitants are unjust.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, 'We shall destroy the people of this city, for its people are evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And when Our messengers came unto Ibrahim with the glad tidings, they said: verily we are about to destroy the inhabitants of that city: verily the inhabitants thereof have been wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when Our Messengers came to Ibrahim (Abraham) with the glad tidings they said: "Verily, we are going to destroy the people of this [Lout's (Lot's)] town (i.e. the town of Sodom in Palestine) truly, its people have been Zalimun [wrong-doers, polytheists and disobedient to Allah, and have also belied their Messenger Lout (Lot)]."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when Our envoys brought Abraham the good news, they said, “We are going to destroy the people of this town; its people are wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When Our emissaries brought the good news to Abraham, and said (to him): “We are surely going to destroy the inhabitants of this city; its inhabitants are immersed in wrong-doing.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when Our messengers came to Ibrahim with the glad tidings they said: "Verily, we are going to destroy the people of this town; truly, its people have been wrongdoers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Our messengers brought Abraham the good news, they said: Lo! we are about to destroy the people of that township, for its people are wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good news, they said, ‘We are indeed going to destroy the people of this town. Its people are indeed wrongdoers.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Our Messengers brought Abraham the glad tidings they said: 'We are destroying the people of this village, because its people are harmdoers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we will destroy the people of that Lot's city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Our angelic Messengers brought glad news to Abraham, they told him, "We are about to destroy the people of this town for their injustice".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Our apostles came to Ibrahim with the good news, they said: Surely we are going to destroy the people of this town, for its people are unjust.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When Our messengers brought Abraham the good news [of the birth of Isaac] they [also] said, "We are indeed going to destroy the people of this city, for the people of this city are truly wrongdoers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When Our Messengers came to Abraham with the good news, they said: "We are indeed going to destroy the people of this township: for truly they are (addicted to) crime."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember, when his Lord tried Abraham by a number of commands which he fulfilled, God said to him: "I will make you a leader among men." And when Abraham asked: "From my progeny too?" the Lord said: "My pledge does not include transgressors."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim’s (Abraham’s) Lord tested him in some matters and he fulfilled them; He said, “I am going to appoint you as a leader for mankind”; invoked Ibrahim, “And of my offspring”; He said, “My covenant does not include the unjust (wrong-doers).”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when his Lord tested Abraham with certain words, and he fulfilled them. He said, 'Behold, I make you a leader for the people.' Said he, 'And of my seed?' He said 'My covenant shall not reach the evildoers.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time his Lord Proved Ibrahim with certain words then he performed them. He said: verily I am going to make thee a leader unto mankind. Ibrahim said: and also of my progeny? Allah said: My covenant shall not reach the wrong-doers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when the Lord of Ibrahim (Abraham) [i.e., Allah] tried him with (certain) Commands, which he fulfilled. He (Allah) said (to him), "Verily, I am going to make you a leader (Prophet) of mankind." [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said, "And of my offspring (to make leaders)." (Allah) said, "My Covenant (Prophethood, etc.) includes not Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when his Lord tested Abraham with certain words, and he fulfilled them. He said, “I am making you a leader of humanity.” He said, “And my descendants?” He said, “My pledge does not include the wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Recall to mind that when his Lord put Abraham to test in certain things and he fulfilled all of them, He said, "I am going to make you the leader of mankind." Abraham humbly asked, "Does this promise apply to my descendants also?" He replied, "My promise does not apply to the transgressors."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when the Lord of Ibrahim (Abraham) tried him with (certain) commands, which he fulfilled. He (Allah) said (to him), "Verily, I am going to make you an Imam (a leader) for mankind (to follow you)." (Ibrahim) said, "And of my offspring (to make leaders)." (Allah) said, "My covenant (prophethood) includes not Zalimin (polytheists and wrongdoers)."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (remember) when his Lord tried Abraham with (His) commands, and he fulfilled them, He said: Lo! I have appointed thee a leader for mankind. (Abraham) said: And of my offspring (will there be leaders)? He said: My covenant includeth not wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When his Lord tested Abraham with certain words and he fulfilled them, He said, ‘I am making you the Imam of mankind.’ Said he, ‘And from among my descendants?’ He said, ‘My pledge does not extend to the unjust.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Abraham was tested by His Lord with certain words and he fulfilled them, He said: 'I have appointed you as a leader for the nation' (Abraham) asked: 'And of my descendants' 'My covenant' said He, 'the harmdoers shall not receive it'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham was tried by his Lord with commands and he fulfilled them. [Allah] said, "Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people." [Abraham] said, "And of my descendants?" [Allah] said, "My covenant does not include the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When his Lord tested Abraham's faith, (by His words) and he satisfied the test, He said, "I am appointing you as the leader of mankind." Abraham asked, "Will this leadership also continue through my descendants?" The Lord replied, "The unjust do not have the right to exercise My authority."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when his Lord tried Ibrahim with certain words, he fulfilled them. He said: Surely I will make you an Imam of men. Ibrahim said: And of my offspring? My covenant does not include the unjust, said He.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When his Lord tested Abraham with certain commands and he fulfilled them, He said, "I will make you a leader of men." Abraham asked, "And what of my descendants?" He answered, "My covenant does not extend to the transgressors."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember that Abraham was tried by his Lord with certain commands, which he fulfilled: He said: "I will make thee an Imam to the Nations." He pleaded: "And also (Imams) from my offspring!" He answered: "But My Promise is not within the reach of evil-doers."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember, We made the House (of Ka'bah) a place of congregation and safe retreat, and said: "Make the spot where Abraham stood the place of worship;" and enjoined upon Abraham and Ishmael to keep Our House immaculate for those who shall walk around it and stay in it for contemplation and prayer, and for bowing in adoration.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember when We made this House (at Mecca) a recourse for mankind and a sanctuary; and take the place where Ibrahim stood, as your place of prayer; and We imposed a duty upon Ibrahim and Ismail (Ishmael), to fully purify My house for those who go around it, and those who stay in it (for worship), and those who bow down and prostrate themselves.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when We appointed the House to be a place of visitation for the people, and a sanctuary, and: 'Take to yourselves Abraham's station for a place of prayer.' And We made covenant with Abraham and Ishmael: 'Purify My House for those that shall go about it and those that cleave to it, to those who bow and prostrate themselves.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time We appointed the House a resort unto man kind and a place of security and said: take the station of Ibrahim for a place of prayer. And We covenanted with Ibrahim and Ismai'l, saying: purify ye twain My Houses for those who shall circumambulate it and those who shall stay, and those who shall bow down and prostrate themselves.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We made the House (the Ka'bah at Makkah) a place of resort for mankind and a place of safety. And take you (people) the Maqam (place) of Ibrahim (Abraham) [or the stone on which Ibrahim (Abraham) stood while he was building the Ka'bah] as a place of prayer (for some of your prayers, e.g. two Rak'at after the Tawaf of the Ka'bah at Makkah), and We commanded Ibrahim (Abraham) and Isma'il (Ishmael) that they should purify My House (the Ka'bah at Makkah) for those who are circumambulating it, or staying (I'tikaf), or bowing or prostrating themselves (there, in prayer).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We made the House a focal point for the people, and a sanctuary. Use the shrine of Abraham as a place of prayer. And We commissioned Abraham and Ishmael, “Sanctify My House for those who circle around it, and those who seclude themselves in it, and those who kneel and prostrate.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And remember that We made this House (the Ka'bah) the centre and sanctuary for mankind and enjoined the people to dedicate to worship the place where Abraham used to stand for prayer, and We urged Abraham and Ismail to keep My House pure for those who would go round it and those who would retire to it for devotion and prayer and for those who would bow down and prostrate themselves there in worhsip.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when We made the House (the Ka`bah at Makkah) a place of resort for mankind and a place of safety. And take you (people) the Maqam (place) of Ibrahim as a place of prayer. And We commanded Ibrahim (Abraham) and Isma`il (Ishmael) that they should purify My House (the Ka`bah at Makkah) for those who are circumambulating it, or staying (I`tikaf), or bowing or prostrating themselves (there, in prayer).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We made the House (at Makka) a resort for mankind and sanctuary, (saying): Take as your place of worship the place where Abraham stood (to pray). And We imposed a duty upon Abraham and Ishmael, (saying): Purify My house for those who go around and those who meditate therein and those who bow down and prostrate themselves (in worship).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And [remember] when We made the House a place of reward for mankind and a sanctuary, [declaring], ‘Take the venue of prayer from Abraham’s Station.’ We charged Abraham and Ishmael [with its upkeep, saying], ‘Purify My House for those who go around it, [for] those who make it a retreat and [for] those who bow and prostrate.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when We made the House (Ka'bah) a visitation and a sanctuary for the people (saying:) 'Make the place where Abraham stood a place of prayer. 'And We made a covenant with Abraham and Ishmael: 'Purify My House for those who circumambulate around it, and those who cleave to it, to those who bow and prostrate'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when We made the House a place of return for the people and [a place of] security. And take, [O believers], from the standing place of Abraham a place of prayer. And We charged Abraham and Ishmael, [saying], "Purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who are staying [there] for worship and those who bow and prostrate [in prayer]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We made the house (in Mecca) as a place of refuge and sanctuary for men. Adopt the place where Abraham stood as a place for prayer. We advised Abraham and Ishmael to keep My house clean for the pilgrims, the worshippers and for those who bow down and prostrate themselves in worship.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We made the House a pilgrimage for men and a (place of) security, and: Appoint for yourselves a place of prayer on the standing-place of Ibrahim. And We enjoined Ibrahim and Ismail saying: Purify My House for those who visit (it) and those who abide (in it) for devotion and those who bow down (and) those who prostrate themselves.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And We made the House [the Ka'bah] a place of assembly and a sanctuary for mankind, [saying], "Make the place where Abraham stood a place of worship." We commanded Abraham and Ishmael, "Purify My House for those who walk round it, those who stay there for devotion, and those who bow down and prostrate themselves."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Remember We made the House a place of assembly for men and a place of safety; and take ye the station of Abraham as a place of prayer; and We covenanted with Abraham and Isma'il, that they should sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or use it as a retreat, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And when Abraham said: "O Lord, make this a city of peace, and give those of its citizens who believe in God and the Last Day fruits for food," He answered: "To those will I also give a little who believe not, for a time, then drag them to Hell, a dreadful destination!"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim prayed, “My Lord! Make this city a place of security and bestow upon its people various fruits as providence – for those among them who believe in Allah and the Last Day (of Resurrection)”; He answered, “And whoever disbelieves, I shall provide him also some subsistence and then compel him towards the punishment of fire (hell); and that is a wretched place to return.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Abraham said, 'My Lord, make this a land secure, and provide its people with fruits, such of them as believe in God and the Last Day.' He said, 'And whoso disbelieves, to him I shall give enjoyment a little, then I shall compel him to the chastisement of the Fire -- how evil a homecoming!'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Ibrahim said: my Lord! make this city a place of security, and provide the People thereof with fruits, - such of them as will believe in Allah and the last Day. Allah said: and whosoever will disbelieve, him also shall give enjoyment for a while; thereafter I shall drive him to the torment of the Fire, - an ill abode!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said, "My Lord, make this city (Makkah) a place of security and provide its people with fruits, such of them as believe in Allah and the Last Day." He (Allah) answered: "As for him who disbelieves, I shall leave him in contentment for a while, then I shall compel him to the torment of the Fire, and worst indeed is that destination!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: When Abraham said, “O My Lord, make this a peaceful land, and provide its people with fruits—whoever of them believes in God and the Last Day.” He said, “And whoever disbelieves, I will give him a little enjoyment, then I will consign him to the punishment of the Fire; how miserable the destiny!”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And remember that Abraham prayed, "Lord, make this city a city of peace and security, and provide with every kind of fruit those of its people, who believe in Allah and the Last Day'. Allah answered, "As for the disbelievers, I will also provide them with the necessities of life in this world, though in the Next World I will drag them to the torment of Hell, and that is the worst abode."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim said, "My Lord, make this city (Makkah) a place of security and provide its people with fruits, such of them as believe in Allah and the Last Day." He (Allah) answered: "As for him who disbelieves, I shall leave him in contentment for a while, then I shall compel him to the torment of the Fire, and worst indeed is that destination!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Abraham prayed: My Lord! Make this a region of security and bestow upon its people fruits, such of them as believe in Allah and the Last Day, He answered: As for him who disbelieveth, I shall leave him in contentment for a while, then I shall compel him to the doom of Fire - a hapless journey's end!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And when Abraham said, ‘My Lord, make this a secure town, and provide its people with fruits—such of them as have faith in Allah and the Last Day,’ He said, ‘As for him who is faithless, I will provide for him [too] for a short time, then I will shove him toward the punishment of the Fire and it is an evil destination.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Abraham said: 'My Lord, make this country safe and provide its inhabitants whosoever of them believes in Allah and the Last Day with fruits' He said: 'And whosoever disbelieves, to him I shall give enjoyment for a while. Then I shall compel him to the punishment of the Fire, how evil an arrival'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a secure city and provide its people with fruits - whoever of them believes in Allah and the Last Day." [Allah] said. "And whoever disbelieves - I will grant him enjoyment for a little; then I will force him to the punishment of the Fire, and wretched is the destination."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Abraham prayed to the Lord saying, "Lord, make this town a place of security and provide those in the town who believe in God and the Day of Judgement, with plenty," God replied, "I shall allow those who hide the truth to enjoy themselves for a while. Then I shall drive them into the torment of hell fire, a terrible destination!"

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim said: My Lord, make it a secure town and provide its people with fruits, such of them as believe in Allah and the last day. He said: And whoever disbelieves, I will grant him enjoyment for a short while, then I will drive him to the chastisement of the fire; and it is an evil destination.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And when Abraham prayed, "My Lord, make this city a city of peace, and provide its inhabitants with fruits, such of them as believe in God and the Last Day." God said, "As for those who deny the truth, I will grant them benefits for a short while and then subject them to the punishment of the Fire -- an evil destination."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember Abraham said: "My Lord, make this a City of Peace, and feed its people with fruits,-such of them as believe in Allah and the Last Day." He said: "(Yea), and such as reject Faith,-for a while will I grant them their pleasure, but will soon drive them to the torment of Fire,- an evil destination (indeed)!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And when Abraham was raising the plinth of the House with Ishmael, (he prayed): "Accept this from us, O Lord, for You hear and know everything;

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim was raising the foundations of the House, along with Ismail; (saying), “Our Lord! Accept it from us; indeed You only are the All Hearing, the All Knowing.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Abraham, and Ishmael with him, raised up the foundations of the House: 'Our Lord, receive this from us; Thou art the All-hearing, the All-knowing;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Ibrahim was raising the foundation of the House and also Ismai'l, praying: our Lord! accept of us; verily Thou! Thou art the Hearer, the Knower!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) and (his son) Isma'il (Ishmael) were raising the foundations of the House (the Ka'bah at Makkah), (saying), "Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us. Verily! You are the All-Hearer, the All-Knower."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: As Abraham raises the foundations of the House, together with Ishmael, “Our Lord, accept it from us, You are the Hearer, the Knower.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And remember that when Abraham and Ishmael were raising the walls of the House, they prayed, "Lord, accept this service from us; You are All-Hearing and All-Knowing.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim and (his son) Isma`il were raising the foundations of the House (the Ka`bah at Makkah), (saying), "Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us. Verily, You are the Hearer, the Knower."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Abraham and Ishmael were raising the foundations of the House, (Abraham prayed): Our Lord! Accept from us (this duty). Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Hearer, the Knower.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: As Abraham raised the foundations of the House with Ishmael, [they prayed]: ‘Our Lord, accept it from us! Indeed You are the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when Abraham and Ishmael raised the foundations of the House (supplicating): 'O our Lord, accept this from us, You are the Hearer, the Knower.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ishmael, [saying], "Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: While Abraham and Ishmael were raising the foundation of the house, they prayed, "Lord, accept our labor. You are All-hearing and All-knowing.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim and Ismail raised the foundations of the House: Our Lord! accept from us; surely Thou art the Hearing, the Knowing:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And when Abraham and Ishmael were laying the foundations of the House, [they prayed], "Our Lord, accept this from us; for You are All Hearing, All Knowing.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And remember Abraham and Isma'il raised the foundations of the House (With this prayer): "Our Lord! Accept (this service) from us: For Thou art the All-Hearing, the All-knowing.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Were you present at the hour of Jacob's death? "What will you worship after me?" he asked his sons, and they answered: "We shall worship your God and the God of your fathers, of Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac, the one and only God; and to Him we submit."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: In fact, some of you yourselves were present when death approached Yaqub and when he said to his sons, “What will you worship after me?” They said, “We shall worship Him Who is your God, and is the God of your fathers, Ibrahim and Ismail and Ishaq (Isaac) – the One God; and to Him we have submitted ourselves.”

translation.author: Arberry
