translation.text: We have revealed to you as We revealed to Noah and to the Prophets after him, and We revealed to (Prophets) Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the tribes, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and We gave to David the Psalms.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And we revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), We have sent revelations to you just as were sent to Noah and the Prophets who lived after him and to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, his descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon. We gave the Psalms to David.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely We have revealed to you as We revealed to Nuh, and the prophets after him, and We revealed to Ibrahim and Ismail and Ishaq and Yaqoub and the tribes, and Isa and Ayub and Yunus and Haroun and Sulaiman and We gave to Dawood

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We have sent revelation to you [Prophet] as We did to Noah and the prophets who came after him, to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, to Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon and David, to whom We gave the Psalms.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We have sent thee inspiration, as We sent it to Noah and the Messengers after him: we sent inspiration to Abraham, Isma'il, Isaac, Jacob and the Tribes, to Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and solomon, and to David We gave the Psalms.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And of Abraham who fulfilled his trust? --

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And of Ibrahim, who was most obedient?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and Abraham, he who paid his debt in full?

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And of Ibrahim who faithfully fulfilled?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And of Ibrahim (Abraham) who fulfilled (or conveyed) all that (what Allah ordered him to do or convey),

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And of Abraham, who fulfilled?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and of Abraham, who lived up to the trust?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And of Ibrahim who fulfilled all that:

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Abraham who paid his debt:

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and of Abraham, who fulfilled [his summons]:

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and Abraham, who paid his debt in full?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [of] Abraham, who fulfilled [his obligations] -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: and about Abraham who fulfilled his duty (to God)?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And (of) Ibrahim who fulfilled (the commandments):

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And with Abraham who kept his word:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements?-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham, and gave prophethood to their progeny and the Book, and some of them are well-directed, but many of them are disobedient.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent Nooh and Ibrahim, and placed Prophethood and the Book among their descendants, so some among them took to guidance; and many of them are sinners.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent Noah, and Abraham, and We appointed the Prophecy and the Book to be among their seed; and some of them are guided, and many of them are ungodly.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly We sent Nuh and Ibrahim, and We placed in the posterity of the twain the prophecy and the Book. Then of them some are guided ones, and many of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) and Ibrahim (Abraham), and placed in their offspring Prophethood and Scripture, and among them there is he who is guided, but many of them are Fasiqun (rebellious, disobedient to Allah).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and the Scripture. Some of them are guided, but many of them are sinners.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed We sent forth Noah and Abraham and established in their line Prophecy and the Book. Then some of them embraced the guidance and many of them are wicked.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed, We sent Nuh and Ibrahim, and placed in their offspring prophethood and Scripture. And among them there are some who are guided; but many of them are rebellious.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily sent Noah and Abraham and placed the prophethood and the scripture among their seed, and among them there is he who goeth right, but many of them are evil-livers.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We sent Noah and Abraham and We ordained among their descendants prophethood and the Book. Some of them are [rightly] guided, and many of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent forth Noah and Abraham, and appointed the Prophethood and the Book to be given to their descendants. Some were guided, but many wereimpious.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Noah and Abraham and placed prophethood and the Book among their offsprings, some of whom have the right guidance. However, most of them are evil doers.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We sent Nuh and Ibrahim and We gave to their offspring the (gift of) prophecy and the Book; so there are among them those who go aright, and most of them are transgressors.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent forth Noah and Abraham and bestowed upon their offspring prophethood and the Book. Some of them were rightly guided, but many others were transgressors.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and Revelation: and some of them were on right guidance. But many of them became rebellious transgressors.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: You have an excellent model in Abraham and those who were with him, when he said to his people: "We are through with you, and those you worship other than God. We reject you. Enmity and hate have come between you and us for ever, unless you believe in God the One," -- except for what he said to his father: "I shall ask forgiveness for you, but I have no power to prevail with God for you." "O Lord, we place our trust in You, and turn to You in penitence, and to You is our returning.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed in Ibrahim, and those along with him, lay a good example for you follow – when they said to their people, “Indeed we are unconcerned with you and all what you worship besides Allah; we reject you, and between us and you has surfaced enmity and hatred for ever until you accept faith in the One Allah” – except the saying of Ibrahim to his father, “I will surely seek forgiveness for you, and I do not possess any power to benefit you against Allah”; “O our Lord! We have relied only upon You, and towards You only we have inclined and only towards You is the return”.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: You have had a good example in Abraham, and those with him, when they said to their people, 'We are quit of you and that you serve, apart from God. We disbelieve in you, and between us and you enmity has shown itself, and hatred for ever, until you believe in God alone. (Except that Abraham said unto his father, 'Certainly I shall ask pardon for thee; but I have no power to do aught for thee against God.') 'Our Lord, in Thee we trust; to Thee we turn; to Thee is the homecoming.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Surely there hath been an excellent pattern for you in Ibrahim and those with him, when they said Unto their people; verily we are quit of you and of that which ye worship beside Allah; we renounce you; and surely there hath appeared between us and you hostility and hatred for evermore until ye believe in Allah alone, - except the saying of Ibrahim Unto his father: surely I shall beg forgiveness for thee, and I have no power with Allah for thee at all. Our Lord! in Thee we put our trust, and Unto Thee we turn, and Unto Thee is the journeying.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Indeed there has been an excellent example for you in Ibrahim (Abraham) and those with him, when they said to their people: "Verily, we are free from you and whatever you worship besides Allah, we have rejected you, and there has started between us and you, hostility and hatred for ever, until you believe in Allah Alone," except the saying of Ibrahim (Abraham) to his father: "Verily, I will ask for forgiveness (from Allah) for you, but I have no power to do anything for you before Allah." Our Lord! In You (Alone) we put our trust, and to You (Alone) we turn in repentance, and to You (Alone) is (our) final Return,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: You have had an excellent example in Abraham and those with him; when they said to their people, “We are quit of you, and what you worship apart from God. We denounce you. Enmity and hatred has surfaced between us and you, forever, until you believe in God alone.” Except for the words of Abraham to his father, “I will ask forgiveness for you, though I have no power from God to do anything for you.” “Our Lord, in You we trust, and to You we repent, and to You is the ultimate resort.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: You have a good example in Abraham and his companions: they said to their people: “We totally dissociate ourselves from you, and from the deities that you worship instead of Allah. We renounce you and there has come to be enmity and hatred between us and you until you believe in Allah, the One True God.” (But you may not emulate) Abraham's saying to his father: “Certainly I will ask pardon for you, although I have no power over Allah to obtain anything on your behalf.” (And Abraham and his companions prayed): “Our Lord, in You have we put our trust, and to You have we turned, and to You is our ultimate return.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Indeed there has been an excellent example for you in Ibrahim and those with him, when they said to their people: "Verily, we are free from you and whatever you worship besides Allah, we have rejected you, and there has started between us and you, hostility and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone," -- except the saying of Ibrahim to his father: "Verily, I will ask forgiveness for you, but I have no power to do anything for you before Allah." "Our Lord! In You we put our trust, and to You we turn in repentance, and to You is the final Return."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: There is a goodly pattern for you in Abraham and those with him, when they told their folk: Lo! we are guiltless of you and all that ye worship beside Allah. We have done with you. And there hath arisen between us and you hostility and hate for ever until ye believe in Allah only - save that which Abraham promised his father (when he said): I will ask forgiveness for thee, though I own nothing for thee from Allah - Our Lord! In Thee we put our trust, and unto Thee we turn repentant, and unto Thee is the journeying.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: There is certainly a good exemplar for you in Abraham and those who were with him, when they said to their own people, ‘Indeed we repudiate you and whatever you worship besides Allah. We disown you, and enmity and hate have appeared between you and us for ever, unless you come to have faith in Allah alone,’ apart from Abraham’s saying to his father, ‘I will surely plead forgiveness for you, though I cannot avail you anything against Allah.’ ‘Our Lord! In You do we put our trust, and to You do we turn penitently, and toward You is the destination.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: You have a good example in Abraham and those with him. They said to their nation: 'We are quit of you, and that which you worship, other than Allah. We disbelieve you, enmity and hatred has shown itself between us for ever until you believe in Allah alone' Except that Abraham said to his father: 'Surely, I shall supplicate to ask for forgiveness for you although I have no power to do anything for you with Allah' ' Our Lord, in You we have put our trust; to You we turn, and to You is the arrival,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: There has already been for you an excellent pattern in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, "Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allah. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone" except for the saying of Abraham to his father, "I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allah. Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham and those with him are the best examples for you to follow. They told the people, "We have nothing to do with you and with those whom you worship besides God. We have rejected you. Enmity and hatred will separate us forever unless you believe in One God." Abraham told his father, "I shall ask forgiveness for you only, but I shall not be of the least help to you before God".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Indeed, there is for you a good example in Ibrahim and those with him when they said to their people: Surely we are clear of you and of what you serve besides Allah; we declare ourselves to be clear of you, and enmity and hatred have appeared between us and you forever until you believe in Allah alone-- but not in what Ibrahim said to his father: I would certainly ask forgiveness for you, and I do not control for you aught from Allah-- Our Lord! on Thee do we rely, and to Thee do we turn, and to Thee is the eventual coming:

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Indeed you have an excellent example in Abraham and those who followed him, when they said to their people, "We disown you and whatever you worship besides God. We renounce you. Enmity and hatred shall endure between us and you, until you believe in the one God." [The exception was] when Abraham said to his father, "I shall indeed pray for [God"s] forgiveness for you; although I do not have it in my power to obtain anything from God on your behalf." They prayed, "O our Lord, in You we have placed our trust and to You we turn in repentance and to You is the final return.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: There is for you an excellent example (to follow) in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people: "We are clear of you and of whatever ye worship besides Allah: we have rejected you, and there has arisen, between us and you, enmity and hatred for ever,- unless ye believe in Allah and Him alone": But not when Abraham said to his father: "I will pray for forgiveness for thee, though I have no power (to get) aught on thy behalf from Allah." (They prayed): "Our Lord! in Thee do we trust, and to Thee do we turn in repentance: to Thee is (our) Final Goal.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Tell them: "My Lord has directed me to a path that is straight, a supreme law, the creed of Abraham the upright who was not an idolater."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Say, “Indeed my Lord has guided me to the Straight Path; the right religion, (of) the community of Ibrahim who was free from all falsehood; and was not a polytheist.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Say: 'As for me, my Lord has guided me to a straight path, a right religion, the creed of Abraham, a man of pure faith; he was no idolater.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Say thou as for me, my Lord hath guided me unto a straight path, a right religion, the faith of Ibrahim, the upright, and he was not of the associaters.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Truly, my Lord has guided me to a Straight Path, a right religion, the religion of Ibrahim (Abraham), Hanifa [i.e. the true Islamic Monotheism - to believe in One God (Allah i.e. to worship none but Allah, Alone)] and he was not of Al-Mushrikun (see V. 2:105)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Say, “My Lord has guided me to a straight path, an upright religion, the creed of Abraham the Monotheist, who was not a polytheist.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Say: 'As for me, my Lord has guided me on to a straight way, a right religion, the way of Abraham who adopted it in exclusive devotion to Allah, and he was not of those who associated others with Allah in His divinity.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Say: "Truly, my Lord has guided me to a straight path, a right religion, the religion of Ibrahim, Hanifan (monotheism) and he was not of the Mushrikin."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Say: Lo! As for me, my Lord hath guided me unto a straight path, a right religion, the community of Abraham, the upright, who was no idolater.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Say, ‘Indeed my Lord has guided me to a straight path, the upright religion, the creed of Abraham, a Hanif, and he was not one of the polytheists.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Say: 'My Lord has guided me to a Straight Path, an upright religion, the creed of Abraham, he was upright, not from the idolaters'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Say, "Indeed, my Lord has guided me to a straight path - a correct religion - the way of Abraham, inclining toward truth. And he was not among those who associated others with Allah."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), tell them, "My Lord has guided me to the right path, a well established religion and the upright tradition of Abraham who was not a pagan".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Say: Surely, (as for) me, my Lord has guided me to the right path; (to) a most right religion, the faith of Ibrahim the upright one, and he was not of the polytheists.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Say, "My Lord has guided me to a straight path, and to an upright religion, the religion of Abraham the upright, who was not of those who associate partners with God."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Say: "Verily, my Lord hath guided me to a way that is straight,- a religion of right,- the path (trod) by Abraham the true in Faith, and he (certainly) joined not gods with Allah."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember when Abraham said to Azar, his father: "Why do you take idols for God? I certainly find you and your people in error."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember when Ibrahim said to his father (paternal uncle) Azar, “What! You appoint idols as Gods? Indeed I find you and your people in open error.” (Prophet Ibrahim was rightly guided since birth).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when Abraham said to his father Azar, 'Takest thou idols for gods? I see thee, and thy people, in manifest error.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recall what time Ibrahim said unto his father Azar: takest thou idols for gods! Verily I see thee and thy people in error manifest.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father Azar: "Do you take idols as aliha (gods)? Verily, I see you and your people in manifest error.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Abraham said to his father Azar, “Do you take idols for gods? I see that you and your people are in evident error.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recall when Abraham said to his father, Azar: 'Do you take idols for gods? I see you and your people in obvious error.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim said to his father Azar: "Do you take idols as gods Verily, I see you and your people in manifest error."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Remember) when Abraham said unto his father Azar: Takest thou idols for gods? Lo! I see thee and thy folk in error manifest.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Abraham said to Azar, his father, ‘Do you take idols for gods? Indeed I see you and your people in manifest error.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (And remember) when Abraham said to his father Azar: 'Will you take idols for gods, surely I see you and your people are in clear error'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father Azar, "Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Consider when Abraham asked his father, Azar, "Why do you believe idols to be your gods? I find you and your people in absolute error".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Ibrahim said to his sire, Azar: Do you take idols for gods? Surely I see you and your people in manifest error.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Remember when Abraham said to his father, Azar, "Do you take idols as your gods? I see that you and your people have clearly gone astray."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Lo! Abraham said to his father Azar: "Takest thou idols for gods? For I see thee and thy people in manifest error."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Thus We showed to Abraham the visible and invisible world of the heavens and the earth, that he could be among those who believe.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And likewise We showed Ibrahim the entire kingdom of the heavens and the earth and so that he be of those who believe as eyewitnesses.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So We were showing Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and earth, that he might be of those having sure faith.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And in this wise We showed unto Ibrahim the governance of the heavens and the earth, and that he might become of the convinced.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Thus did we show Ibrahim (Abraham) the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he be one of those who have Faith with certainty.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Thus We showed Abraham the empire of the heavens and the earth, that he might be one of those with certainty.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And thus We showed Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, so that he might become one of those who have sure faith.. The adversaries are told that they can observe God's signs in the phenomena of the universe, just as Abraham could. The difference is that they see nothing, as if they were blind, whereas Abraham saw with open eyes. The sun, moon and stars which rise and set before their eyes day after day and night after night witness them as misguided at their setting as at their rising. Yet the same signs were observed by the perceptive Abraham, and the physical phenomena helped him arrive at the Truth.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Thus did we show Ibrahim the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he be one of those who have faith with certainty.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Thus did We show Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he might be of those possessing certainty:

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thus did We show Abraham the dominions of the heavens and the earth, that he might be of those who possess certitude.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And so We showed Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, so that he might be of those who are certain.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith]

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Also, We showed (Abraham) the kingdom of the heavens and the earth to strengthen his faith.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And thus did We show Ibrahim the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and that he might be of those who are sure.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: In this way We showed Abraham Our kingdom of the heavens and the earth, so that he might have certainty of faith.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So also did We show Abraham the power and the laws of the heavens and the earth, that he might (with understanding) have certitude.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: This is the argument We gave to Abraham against his people. We exalt whosoever We please in rank by degrees. Your Lord is wise and all-knowing.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And this is Our argument, which We gave Ibrahim against his people; We raise to high ranks whomever We will; indeed your Lord is Wise, All Knowing.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: That is Our argument, which We bestowed upon Abraham as against his people. We raise up in degrees whom We will; surely thy Lord is All-wise, All-knowing.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And this was Our argument which We vouchsafed unto Ibrahim against his people. We raise in degrees whomsoever We list; verily thy Lord is Wise, Knowing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And that was Our Proof which We gave Ibrahim (Abraham) against his people. We raise whom We will in degrees. Certainly your Lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: That was Our argument which We gave to Abraham against his people. We elevate by degrees whomever We will. Your Lord is Wise and Informed.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: That was Our argument which We gave to Abraham against his people. We raise in ranks whom We will. Truly your lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And that was Our proof which We gave Ibrahim against his people. We in degrees raise whom We will. Certainly your Lord is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: That is Our argument. We gave it unto Abraham against his folk. We raise unto degrees of wisdom whom We will. Lo! thy Lord is Wise, Aware.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: This was Our argument that We gave to Abraham against his people. We raise in rank whomever We wish. Indeed your Lord is all-wise, all-knowing.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Such is the argument that We gave Abraham against his nation. We raise whom We will to an exalted rank. Your Lord is Wise, Knowing.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And that was Our [conclusive] argument which We gave Abraham against his people. We raise by degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Such was the authoritative reasoning that We gave Abraham over his people. We raise whomever We want to a higher rank. Your Lord is All-wise and All-knowing.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And this was Our argument which we gave to Ibrahim against his people; We exalt in dignity whom We please; surely your Lord is Wise, Knowing.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: This is the reasoning We gave to Abraham against his people, We raise in rank anyone We please, your Lord is wise and aware.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: That was the reasoning about Us, which We gave to Abraham (to use) against his people: We raise whom We will, degree after degree: for thy Lord is full of wisdom and knowledge.

translation.text: In the Books of Ibrahim and Moosa.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: As for Abraham's prayer for his father, he was fulfilling a promise he had made to him. Yet when it became evident to him that (his father) was an enemy of God, he broke away from him, though Abraham was soft hearted and kind.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And the seeking of forgiveness for his father (paternal uncle) by Ibrahim was only because of a promise he had made to him; then when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, Ibrahim broke off ties with him; indeed Ibrahim is surely very soft-hearted, most forbearing.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Abraham asked not pardon for his father except because of a promise he had made to him; and when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he declared himself quit of him; Abraham was compassionate, clement.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Ibrahim's asking for the forgiveness of his father was only in pursuance of a promise which he had made unto him. Then, when it became manifest unto him that he was an enemy of Allah, he declared himself quit of him. Verily Ibrahim was long-suffering, forbearing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And [Ibrahim's (Abraham)] invoking (of Allah) for his father's forgiveness was only because of a promise he [Ibrahim (Abraham)] had made to him (his father). But when it became clear to him [Ibrahim (Abraham)] that he (his father) is an enemy to Allah, he dissociated himself from him. Verily Ibrahim (Abraham) was Al-Awwah (has fifteen different meanings but the correct one seems to be that he used to invoke Allah with humility, glorify Him and remember Him much), and was forbearing. (Tafsir Al-Qurtubi).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Abraham asked forgiveness for his father only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of God, he disowned him. Abraham was kind and clement.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Abraham's prayer for the forgiveness of his father was only because of a promise which he had made to him. Then, when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, he dissociated himself from him. Surely Abraham was most tender-hearted, God-fearing, forbearing.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And Ibrahim's invoking (of Allah) for his father's forgiveness was only because of a promise he [Ibrahim] had made to him (his father). But when it became clear to him [Ibrahim] that he (his father) is an enemy of Allah, he dissociated himself from him. Verily, Ibrahim was Awwah and forbearing.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The prayer of Abraham for the forgiveness of his father was only because of a promise he had promised him, but when it had become clear unto him that he (his father) was an enemy to Allah he (Abraham) disowned him. Lo! Abraham was soft of heart, long-suffering.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Abraham’s pleading forgiveness for his father was only to fulfill a promise he had made him. So when it became manifest to him that he was an enemy of God, he repudiated him. Indeed Abraham was most plaintive and forbearing.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Abraham only asked for forgiveness for his father because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, he declared himself quit of him. Surely, Abraham was earnest in his supplication and tenderhearted.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the request of forgiveness of Abraham for his father was only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became apparent to Abraham that his father was an enemy to Allah, he disassociated himself from him. Indeed was Abraham compassionate and patient.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: There was no other reason for Abraham to seek forgiveness from God for his father except the promise that he had made with him. When Abraham knew that his father was an enemy of God, he disowned his father. Abraham was very tender-hearted and forbearing.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And Ibrahim asking forgiveness for his sire was only owing to a promise which he had made to him; but when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, he declared himself to be clear of him; most surely Ibrahim was very tender-hearted forbearing.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham's asking forgiveness for his father was only because of a promise he had made to him, but when it became clear to him, that he was God's enemy, he disassociated himself from him. Surely, Abraham was most tender-hearted and forbearing.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And Abraham prayed for his father's forgiveness only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy to Allah, he dissociated himself from him: for Abraham was most tender-hearted, forbearing.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: These are (some of) those who were favoured by God among the prophets of the progeny of Adam, and of those We bore in the ark with Noah, and the offspring of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and We chose, for they bowed weeping in adoration when the revelations of Ar-Rahman were recited to them.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: It is these upon whom Allah has bestowed favour among the Prophets, from the descendants of Adam; and from those whom We boarded along with Nooh; and from the descendants of Ibrahim and Israel; and from those whom We guided and chose; when the verses of the Most Gracious were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating and weeping. (* Command of Prostration # 5.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: These are they whom God has blessed among the Prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those We bore with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: These are they whom Allah hath favoured, from among the prophets, of the progeny of Adam and of them whom We bare with Nuh, and of the progeny of Ibrahim and Isra'il, and of those whom We have guided and chosen; whenever the revelations of the Compassionate were rehearsed unto them, they fell down prostrating themselves and weeping. *Chapter: 19

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His Grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh (Noah), and of the offspring of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Israel and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Verses of the Most Beneficent (Allah) were recited unto them, they fell down prostrating and weeping.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: These are some of the prophets God has blessed, from the descendants of Adam, and from those We carried with Noah, and from the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and from those We guided and selected. Whenever the revelations of the Most Gracious are recited to them, they would fall down, prostrating and weeping.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: These are the Prophets upon whom Allah bestowed His favour from the seed of Adam, and from the seed of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and from the seed of Abraham and Israel. They were those whom We guided and chose (for an exalted position). They were such that when the words of the Most Compassionate Lord were recited to them, they fell down in prostration, weeping.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh, and of the offspring of Ibrahim and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Ayat of the Most Gracious were recited unto them, they fell down prostrate and weeping.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: These are they unto whom Allah showed favour from among the prophets, of the seed of Adam and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the revelations of the Beneficent were recited unto them, they fell down, adoring and weeping.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: They are the ones whom Allah has blessed from among the prophets of Adam’s progeny, and from [the progeny of] those We carried with Noah, and from among the progeny of Abraham and Israel, and from among those that We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-beneficent were recited to them, they would fall down weeping in prostration.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: These were the Prophets from the offspring of Adam, from those who embarked with Noah and from the offspring of Abraham and Israel. God guided them and chose them for His favor. Whenever they would hear the revelations of the Beneficent God they would bow down in prostration with tears.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: These are they on whom Allah bestowed favors, from among the prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those whom We carried with Nuh, and of the seed of Ibrahim and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose; when the communications of the Beneficent Allah were recited to them, they fell down making obeisance and weeping.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: These are the ones whom God has favoured: the prophets from among the descendants of Adam and of those whom We carried in the Ark with Noah; the descendants of Abraham, of Israel, and of those whom We have guided and chosen. For when the revelations of the Merciful were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating themselves and weeping.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We had earlier given Abraham true direction, for We knew him well.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed Ibrahim with guidance from the beginning, and We were Aware of him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We gave Abraham aforetime his rectitude -- for We knew him --

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrahim (Abraham) his (portion of) guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him (as to his Belief in the Oneness of Allah, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Abraham his integrity formerly, and We knew him well.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely We had bestowed wisdom upon Abraham even earlier, and We knew him well.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed We bestowed aforetime on Ibrahim his guidance, and We were Well-Acquainted with him.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We verily gave Abraham of old his proper course, and We were Aware of him,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We had given Abraham his probity before, and We knew him

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Before this We gave Abraham his virtue, for We knew him.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To Abraham We gave the right guidance and We knew him very well.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We gave to Ibrahim his rectitude before, and We knew him fully well.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Before this We gave Abraham his guidance. We knew him well.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Who will turn away from the creed of Abraham but one dull of soul? We made him the chosen one here in the world, and one of the best in the world to come,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And who will renounce the religion of Ibrahim except him who is a fool at heart? We indeed chose him (Ibrahim) in this world; and indeed in the Hereafter he is among those worthy of being closest to Us.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Who therefore shrinks from the religion of Abraham, except he be foolish-minded? Indeed, We chose him in the present world, and in the world to come he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And who shall be averse from the faith of Ibrahim, save one who befooleth his soul! And assuredly We chose him in this World, and verily he in the Hereafter shall be of the righteous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And who turns away from the religion of Ibrahim (Abraham) (i.e. Islamic Monotheism) except him who befools himself? Truly, We chose him in this world and verily, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Who would forsake the religion of Abraham, except he who fools himself? We chose him in this world, and in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Now, who else can have aversion to the way of Abraham but the one who has debased himself with folly and ignorance? Abraham was the man whom We chose for Our service in this world, and in the Next World he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And who turns away from the religion of Ibrahim (i.e. Islamic Monotheism) except him who fools himself Truly, We chose him in this world and verily, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And who forsaketh the religion of Abraham save him who befooleth himself? Verily We chose him in the world, and lo! in the Hereafter he is among the righteous.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And who has no desire for the religion of Abraham, except he who fooled himself? We chose him in this world, and in the Everlasting world, he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham except one who makes a fool of himself. And We had chosen him in this world, and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: No one turns away from Abraham's Tradition except one who makes a fool of himself. To Abraham We have granted distinction in this world and in the life hereafter he will be among the righteous ones.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And who forsakes the religion of Ibrahim but he who makes himself a fool, and most certainly We chose him in this world, and in the hereafter he is most surely among the righteous.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Who but a foolish man would turn away from the religion of Abraham? We chose him in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall be among the righteous.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And who turns away from the religion of Abraham but such as debase their souls with folly? Him We chose and rendered pure in this world: And he will be in the Hereafter in the ranks of the Righteous.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: And Abraham left this legacy to his sons, and to Jacob, and said: "O my sons, God has chosen this as the faith for you. Do not die but as those who have submitted (to God)."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And Ibrahim willed the same religion upon his sons, and also did Yaqub (Jacob); (saying), “O my sons – indeed Allah has chosen this religion for you; therefore do not die except as Muslims (those who submit to Him).”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And Abraham charged his sons with this and Jacob likewise: 'My sons, God has chosen for you the religion; see that you die not save in surrender.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And Ibrahim enjoined his sons the same and did Ya'qub also, saying: O my sons! verily Allah hath chosen for you the religion, so die not except ye be Muslims.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And this (submission to Allah, Islam) was enjoined by Ibrahim (Abraham) upon his sons and by Ya'qub (Jacob), (saying), "O my sons! Allah has chosen for you the (true) religion, then die not except in the Faith of Islam (as Muslims - Islamic Monotheism)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Abraham exhorted his sons, and Jacob, “O my sons, God has chosen this religion for you, so do not die unless you have submitted.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And this (submission to Allah, Islam) was enjoined by Ibrahim (Abraham) upon his sons and by Ya`qub (Jacob) (saying), "O my sons! Allah has chosen for you the (true) religion, then die not except as Muslims."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The same did Abraham enjoin upon his sons, and also Jacob, (saying): O my sons! Lo! Allah hath chosen for you the (true) religion; therefore die not save as men who have surrendered (unto Him).

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Abraham enjoined this [creed] upon his children, and [so did] Jacob, [saying], ‘My children! Allah has indeed chosen this religion for you; so do not die except as those who have surrendered themselves [to Allah].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Abraham charged his children with this, and so did Jacob, saying: 'My sons, Allah has chosen for you the religion. Do not die except being submissive (Muslims)'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Abraham instructed his sons [to do the same] and [so did] Jacob, [saying], "O my sons, indeed Allah has chosen for you this religion, so do not die except while you are Muslims."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham left this legacy to his sons and, in turn, so did Jacob saying, "God has chosen this religion for you. You must not leave this world unless you are a Muslim (submitted to the will of the Lord of the Universe)."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the same did Ibrahim enjoin on his sons and (so did) Yaqoub. O my sons! surely Allah has chosen for you (this) faith, therefore die not unless you are Muslims.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and Abraham enjoined his sons to do the same, as did Jacob, "My sons, God has chosen this religion for you; so do not let death overtake you, except when you are in a state of submission."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And this was the legacy that Abraham left to his sons, and so did Jacob; "Oh my sons! Allah hath chosen the Faith for you; then die not except in the Faith of Islam."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: God had chosen Adam and Noah and the families of Abraham and 'Imran in preference to others.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed Allah chose Adam, and Nooh, and the Family of Ibrahim, and the Family of Imran over the creation.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: God chose Adam and Noah and the House of Abraham and the House of Imran above all beings, the

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Allah chose Adam, Nuh (Noah), the family of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the family of 'Imran above the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns) (of their times).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: God chose Adam, and Noah, and the family of Abraham, and the family of Imran, over all mankind.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Truly Allah chose Adam and Noah and the descendants of Abraham and of 'Imran above all mankind.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Allah chose Adam, Nuh (Noah), the family of Ibrahim and the family of `Imran above the nations.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! Allah preferred Adam and Noah and the Family of Abraham and the Family of 'Imran above (all His) creatures.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed Allah chose Adam and Noah, and the progeny of Abraham and the progeny of Imran above all the nations;

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Allah chose Adam and Noah, the House of Abraham and the House of Imran above all worlds.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: God chose (and gave distinction to) Adam, Noah, the family of Abraham, and Imran over all the people of the world.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely Allah chose Adam and Nuh and the descendants of Ibrahim and the descendants of Imran above the nations.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran above all His creatures.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Allah did choose Adam and Noah, the family of Abraham, and the family of 'Imran above all people,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: It contains clear signs, and the spot where Abraham had stood. And anyone who enters it will find security. And whosoever can afford should visit the House on a pilgrimage as duty to God. Whosoever denies, should remember that God is independent of the peoples of the world.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: In it are clear signs – the place where Ibrahim stood (is one of them); and whoever enters it shall be safe; and performing the Hajj (pilgrimage) of this house, for the sake of Allah, is a duty upon mankind, for those who can reach it; and whoever disbelieves – then Allah is Independent (Unwanting) of the entire creation!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Therein are clear signs -- the station of Abraham, and whosoever enters it is in security. It is the duty of all men towards God to come to the House a pilgrim, if he is able to make his way there. As for the unbeliever, God is All-sufficient nor needs any being.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Therein are signs manifest, the station of Ibrahim. And whosoever entereth it shall be secure. And incumbent on mankind is pilgrimage to the House for that good-will of Allah: on him who is able to find a way thereunto. And whosoever disbelieveth, then verily Allah is Independent of the worlds.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: In it are manifest signs (for example), the Maqam (place) of Ibrahim (Abraham); whosoever enters it, he attains security. And Hajj (pilgrimage to Makkah) to the House (Ka'bah) is a duty that mankind owes to Allah, those who can afford the expenses (for one's conveyance, provision and residence); and whoever disbelieves [i.e. denies Hajj (pilgrimage to Makkah), then he is a disbeliever of Allah], then Allah stands not in need of any of the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: In it are evident signs; the Station of Abraham. Whoever enters it attains security. Pilgrimage to the House is a duty to God for all who can make the journey. But as for those who refuse—God is Independent of the worlds.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: In it there are clear signs and the station of Abraham; whoever enters it becomes secure. Pilgrimage to the House is a duty owed to Allah by all who can make their way to it. As for those who refuse to follow His command, surely Allah does not stand in need of anything.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: In it are manifest signs (for example), the Maqam (station) of Ibrahim; whosoever enters it, he attains security. And Hajj to the House is a duty that mankind owes to Allah, for those who are able to undertake the journey; and whoever disbelieves, then Allah stands not in need of any of the `Alamin.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Wherein are plain memorials (of Allah's guidance); the place where Abraham stood up to pray; and whosoever entereth it is safe. And pilgrimage to the House is a duty unto Allah for mankind, for him who can find a way thither. As for him who disbelieveth, (let him know that) lo! Allah is Independent of (all) creatures.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: In it, there are clear signs; the station where Abraham stood. Whoever enters it let him be safe. Pilgrimage to the House is a duty to Allah for all who can make the journey. And whosoever disbelieves, Allah is Rich, independent of all the worlds.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham. And whoever enters it shall be safe. And [due] to Allah from the people is a pilgrimage to the House - for whoever is able to find thereto a way. But whoever disbelieves - then indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: In (Bakka), there are many clear signs (evidence of the existence of God). Among them is the spot where Abraham stood. Whoever seeks refuge therein will be protected by the laws of amnesty. Those who have the means and ability have a duty to God to visit the House and perform the hajj (pilgrimage) rituals. The unbelievers should know that God is Independent of all creatures.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: In it are clear signs, the standing place of Ibrahim, and whoever enters it shall be secure, and pilgrimage to the House is incumbent upon men for the sake of Allah, (upon) every one who is able to undertake the journey to it; and whoever disbelieves, then surely Allah is Self-sufficient, above any need of the worlds.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: There are clear signs in it; it is the place where Abraham stood. Anyone who enters it will be secure. Pilgrimage to the House is a duty to God for anyone who is able to undertake it. Anyone who disbelieves should remember that God is independent of all creatures.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: In it are Signs Manifest; (for example), the Station of Abraham; whoever enters it attains security; Pilgrimage thereto is a duty men owe to Allah,- those who can afford the journey; but if any deny faith, Allah stands not in need of any of His creatures.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Has not the account of those before them come to them, -- of the people of Noah and 'Ad and Thamud, of Abraham and Midian, and all the habitations that were destroyed? Their apostles had come to them with clear proofs; and God did not surely wrong them, they wronged themselves.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Did not the news of those before them reach them – the people of Nooh, and the A’ad, and the Thamud – the people of Ibrahim, the people of Madyan and the dwellings that were overturned? Their Noble Messengers had brought clear proofs to them; so it did not befit Allah’s Majesty to oppress them, but in fact they wronged themselves.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Has there not come to you the tidings of those who were before you -- the people of Noah, Ad, Thamood, the people of Abraham, the men of Midian and the subverted cities? Their Messengers came to them with the clear signs God would not wrong them, but themselves they wronged.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Have not come to them the tidings of those before them: the people of Nuh and 'Ad and Thamud and the people of Ibrahim and the dwellers of Madyan and of the overturned cities! There came unto them their apostles with evidences. Wherefore Allah was not one to wrong them, but themselves they were wont to wrong.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Has not the story reached them of those before them? - The people of Nuh (Noah), 'Ad, and Thamud, the people of Ibrahim (Abraham), the dwellers of Madyan (Midian) and the cities overthrown [i.e. the people to whom Lout (Lot) preached], to them came their Messengers with clear proofs. So it was not Allah Who wronged them, but they used to wrong themselves.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Have they not heard the stories of those before them? The people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood; and the people of Abraham, and the inhabitants of Median, and the Overturned Cities? Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs. God never wronged them, but they used to wrong their own selves.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Have they not heard the accounts of those who came before them - of the people of Noah and 'Ad and Thamud, and the people of Abraham and the dwellers of Madyan (Midian), and the cities that were overturned? Their Messengers came to them with Clear Signs. Then, it was not Allah Who caused them any wrong; they rather wronged themselves.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Has not the story reached them of those before them -- The people of Nuh,`Ad, Thamud, the people of Ibrahim, the dwellers of Madyan and the overturned cities; to them came their Messengers with clear proofs. So it was not Allah Who wronged them, but they used to wrong themselves.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Hath not the fame of those before them reached them - the folk of Noah, A'ad, Thamud, the folk of Abraham, the dwellers of Midian and the disasters (which befell them)? Their messengers (from Allah) came unto them with proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty). So Allah surely wronged them not, but they did wrong themselves.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Has there not come to them the account of those who were before them—the people of Noah, ‘Ad, and Tham£d, and the people of Abraham, the inhabitants of Midian, and the towns that were overturned? Their apostles brought them manifest proofs. So it was not Allah who wronged them, but it was they who used to wrong themselves.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Has there not reached them the news of those before them - the people of Noah and [the tribes of] 'Aad and Thamud and the people of Abraham and the companions of Madyan and the towns overturned? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Have they not heard the stories of the people of Noah, the tribe of Ad, Thamud, the people of Abraham, the dwellers of the city of Midian, and those of the Subverted Cities? God's Messengers came to each of them with miracles. God did not do any injustice to them, but they wronged themselves.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Has not the news of those before them come to them; of the people of Nuh and Ad and Samood, and the people of Ibrahim and the dwellers of Madyan and the overthrown cities; their apostles came to them with clear arguments; so it was not Allah Who should do them injustice, but they were unjust to themselves.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Have they never heard the stories about their predecessors, the peoples of Noah, 'Ad, Thamud, Abraham, Midian, and of the ruined cities? Their messengers brought them clear evidence of the truth. It was not God who wronged them; they wronged themselves.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Hath not the story reached them of those before them?- the People of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud; the People of Abraham, the men of Midian, and the cities overthrown. To them came their messengers with clear signs. It is not Allah Who wrongs them, but they wrong their own souls.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Relate the news of Abraham to them.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And recite to them the tiding of Abraham

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And recite unto them the story of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim (Abraham).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And relate to them the story of Abraham.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recount to them the story of Abraham:

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Recite unto them the story of Abraham:

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Relate to them the account of Abraham

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Abraham.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And recite to them the news of Abraham,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell them the story of Abraham,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Or do they envy people due to what Allah has given them from His grace? In that case, We bestowed the Book and the wisdom upon the family of Ibrahim (Abraham), and We gave them a great kingdom.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Or are they jealous of the people for the bounty that God has given them? Yet We gave the people of Abraham the Book and the Wisdom, and We gave them a mighty kingdom.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Or envy they the people on account of that which Allah hath vouchsafed unto them out of His grace! so, surely We vouchsafed unto the house of Ibrahim the Book and the wisdom and We vouchsafed unto them a mighty dominion.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Or do they envy men (Muhammad SAW and his followers) for what Allah has given them of His Bounty? Then We had already given the family of Ibrahim (Abraham) the Book and Al-Hikmah (As-Sunnah - Divine Inspiration to those Prophets not written in the form of a book), and conferred upon them a great kingdom.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Or do they envy the people for what God has given them of His grace? We have given the family of Abraham the Book and wisdom, and We have given them a great kingdom.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Do they envy others for the bounty that Allah has bestowed upon them? (Let them bear in mind that) We bestowed upon the house of Abraham the Book and Wis-dom, and We bestowed upon them a mighty dominion,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Or do they envy men for what Allah has given them of His bounty Then, We have already given the family of Ibrahim the Book and Al-Hikmah, and conferred upon them a great kingdom.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Or are they jealous of mankind because of that which Allah of His bounty hath bestowed upon them? For We bestowed upon the house of Abraham (of old) the Scripture and wisdom, and We bestowed on them a mighty kingdom.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Do they envy those people for what Allah has given them out of His bounty? We have certainly given the progeny of Abraham the Book and wisdom, and We have given them a great sovereignty.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Or do they envy people for the Bounty Allah has given them? We gave the family of Abraham the Book and Wisdom, and a great kingdom.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Or do they envy people for what Allah has given them of His bounty? But we had already given the family of Abraham the Scripture and wisdom and conferred upon them a great kingdom.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Are they jealous of the favors that God has done to some people? We have given to the family of Abraham the Book, Wisdom, and a great Kingdom.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Do they envy others because of what God has given them out of His bounty? We granted the House of Abraham the Book and wisdom and We granted them a great kingdom.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Or do they envy mankind for what Allah hath given them of his bounty? but We had already given the people of Abraham the Book and Wisdom, and conferred upon them a great kingdom.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So, when the awe departed from Abraham and the good tidings came to him, he was disputing with Us concerning the people of Lot;

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then when the alarm had departed from Ibrahim and the glad tidings had come home unto him, he took to disputing with us for the people of Lut

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then when the fear had gone away from (the mind of) Ibrahim (Abraham), and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with Us (Our Messengers) for the people of Lout (Lot).

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Thus when fear had left Abraham and the good news had been conveyed to him, he began to dispute with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then when the fear had gone away from (the mind of) Ibrahim, and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with Us (Our messengers) for the people of Lut.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the awe departed from Abraham, and the glad news reached him, he pleaded with Us on behalf of the folk of Lot.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So when the awe had left Abraham and the good news had reached him, he pleaded with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when the wonderment departed from Abraham and the glad tidings reached him, he pleaded with Us for the nation of Lot;

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When Abraham had controlled his fear and received the glad news, he started to plead with Us for the people of Lot;

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: So when fear had gone away from Ibrahim and good news came to him, he began to plead with Us for Lut's people.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When the fear had left Abraham, and the glad tidings had been conveyed to him, he began to plead with Us for Lot's people,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When fear had passed from (the mind of) Abraham and the glad tidings had reached him, he began to plead with us for Lut's people.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Said Ibrahim, “What is your task, O the sent angels?”

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O Messengers?"

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: “Envoys (of Allah), what is your errand?”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Ibrahim) said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O messengers"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Abraham) said: And (afterward) what is your errand, O ye sent (from Allah)?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Messengers' said he (Abraham), 'what is your errand'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham asked, "Messengers, what is your task?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham asked, "What is your errand, O messengers?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Abraham) said: "And what, O ye Messengers, is your errand (now)?"

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And tell them of the guests of Abraham,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And tell them about the guests (the angels) of Ibrahim (Abraham).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And inform them of the guests of Abraham.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And tell them about the guests (i.e., the angels) of Ibrahim.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Tell them about the guests of Abraham

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And inform them of the guests of Ibrahim:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Ibrahim said: peace be on thee! anon shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for thee; verily He is unto me ever so soicitous.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "Peace be on you! I will ask Forgiveness of my Lord for you. Verily! He is unto me, Ever Most Gracious.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham answered: "Peace be upon you. I shall seek pardon for you from my Lord. My Lord has always been kind to Me.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Ibrahim said: "Peace be on you! I will ask forgiveness of my Lord for you. Verily, He is unto me Hafiyyan.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Peace be on you' he (Abraham) said, 'I shall call upon my Lord to forgive you, for to me He has been gracious.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham said, "Peace be with you. I shall ask my Lord to forgive you; He has been gracious to me.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham replied, "Peace be on you: I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness, He has indeed been gracious to me,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Hast thou received the story of the honoured guests of Abraham?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Has the story reached you, of the honoured guests [three angels; Jibrael (Gabriel) along with another two] of Ibrahim (Abraham)?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Has the story reached you, of the honored guests of Ibrahim

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Have you heard the story of the honorable guests of Abraham?

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Has there come to you information about the honored guests of Ibrahim?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Has the story reached thee, of the honoured guests of Abraham?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And Ibrahim said, “You have chosen only idols instead of Allah, with whom your friendship is only in the life of this world; then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny and curse each other; and the destination for all of you is hell, and you do not have supporters.”

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "You have taken (for worship) idols instead of Allah, and the love between you is only in the life of this world, but on the Day of Resurrection, you shall disown each other, and curse each other, and your abode will be the Fire, and you shall have no helper."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And (Ibrahim) said: "You have taken idols instead of Allah. The love between you is only in the life of this world, but on the Day of Resurrection, you shall deny each other, and curse each other, and your abode will be the Fire, and you shall have no helper."

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [Abraham] said, "You have only taken, other than Allah, idols as [a bond of] affection among you in worldly life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham said, "You believe in idols besides God only out of worldly love, but on the Day of Judgment you will reject and condemn each other. Your dwelling will be fire and no one will help you."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham said, "You have taken up the worship of idols, instead of God, to promote friendship between yourselves in the present life. But on the Day of Judgement, you will disown and curse one another. Your abode will be the Fire and you will have no helpers."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Then Lot believed in him; and (Abraham) said: "I will separate myself and take refuge in my Lord. Surely He is all-mighty and all-wise."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So Lut believed in him; and Ibrahim said, “I migrate towards my Lord; indeed only He is the Almighty, the Wise.”

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So Lout (Lot) believed in him [Ibrahim's (Abraham) Message of Islamic Monotheism]. He [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "I will emigrate for the sake of my Lord. Verily, He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then did Lot believe him, and Abraham said: “I am emigrating unto my Lord. He is All-Powerful, All-Wise,”

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Lot believed him. [Abraham] said, "Indeed, I will emigrate to [the service of] my Lord. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Only Lot believed in (Abraham) and said, "I seek refuge in my Lord, for He is Majestic and All-wise".

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: "But there is Lout (Lot) in it." They said:"We know better who is there, we will verily save him [Lout (Lot)] and his family, except his wife, she will be of those who remain behind (i.e. she will be destroyed along with those who will be destroyed from her folk)."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: “But Lot is there.” They replied: “We are well aware of those who are there. We shall save him and all his household except his wife.” His wife is among those who will stay behind.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Ibrahim said: "But there is Lut in it." They said: "We know better who is there. We will verily, save him and his family - except his wife, she will be of those who remain behind."

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Indeed, within it is Lot." They said, "We are more knowing of who is within it. We will surely save him and his family, except his wife. She is to be of those who remain behind."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham said, "Lot is there in that town!" They said, "We know everyone there. We shall certainly save him and his family except his wife who will remain behind."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham said, "But, Lot lives here." They answered, "We well know who lives here. We shall surely save him and his whole family, except his wife, who will be among those who stay behind."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (So Abraham) said: "Then why do you worship something apart from God that cannot profit you or do you harm?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you then worship besides Allah, things that can neither profit you, nor harm you?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: "Do you, then, worship beside Allah a thing that can neither benefit you nor hurt you?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham said, "So, do you worship something instead of God that can neither benefit you nor harm you?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides Allah, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When they entered unto him, and said: Salaman (peace)! [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Indeed! We are afraid of you."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When they came to Abraham they said: "Peace be upon you!" He replied: "Indeed we feel afraid of you."

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: who came to him saying, "Peace be with you." Abraham said, "We are afraid of you".

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: He said, “Do you convey to me the glad tidings upon old age reaching me? So upon what do you convey glad tidings?” (* Prophet Ibrahim said this out of surprise.)

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you give me glad tidings (of a son) when old age has overtaken me? Of what then is your news?"

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Abraham said: "What, do you give me this tiding though old age has smitten me? Just consider what tiding do you give me!"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham asked, "Are you giving me the glad news of a son in my old age? What reason can you give for such glad news?"

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
